description.narrative: Other General Services - support to civil society

comment.narrative: - National environment characterized by a generalized lack of information and awareness on gender, women’s rights and gender equality, mainly on peripheral and rural areas.

1. The capacities of 5 civil society organizations strengthened in gender intervention 2. More than 15.000 increased their awareness and capacity building in political rights and civil participation and economic empowerment through campaigns and trainings 3. 200 girls, sex workers in the municipality of Lobito of Benguela province supported to access social protection services; 4. 30 women empowered and became effective participants in local governance processes, especially in the Social Consultation Councils (consultative bodies of local administrations) 5. 2 Theather groups theatre selected to increase the awareness on combating domestic violence

1. Capacity of 5 CSOs strengthened 2. Strengthened capacities of 17,687 women across 8 provinces of Angola in awareness and capacity building in political rights and civil participation and economic empowerment; 3. 234 4. 40 5. 2 Theather groups presented theatre plays to increase the awareness on combating domestic violence

1. Teams from 5 selected CSOs benefited from 2 trainings, 5 days each, on Women's Rights & GE and on Project Cycle Management 2. 100 domestic workers are aware of their rights and enrolled on Social Security 3. 500 women and girls strengthened their capacity to fight discrimination and reinforced their place in decison making spaces 4. 1000 citizens strengthned their awareness on the importance of gender equality and local development 5. 60 women members of resident committes strengthned their awareness of their social, political and economic rights

description.narrative:
5 Management Effectiveness Tracking Tool scorecard
Iona National Park

comment.narrative:
5 points out of 102 possible giving Jan 2012 5
NOTE ON LOGFRAME 2014
We need to make a correction to the baseline In the PRODOC it mentions a 7 rate However 5 points was the final baseline score and all questions were considered none considered na This gives a total possible points of 102 and a percentage of 5 at the baseline

Target achieved but this needs to be independently vetted Considerable improvement in the METT score has been attained since the original evaluation of November 20 2011 The June 2015 METT evaluation returned a score of 32102 31 in comparison with only 5102 5 in 2011 In the 2011 assessment only three questions 1 5 6 were awarded positive scores totaling 5 of a possible 9 points The same total score for these three questions was also awarded in 2015 However of the 39 questions that received zero scores in 2011 23 received positive scores in the recent evaluation indicating a wideranging improvement in management effectiveness The target of at least 45 in the final evaluation is considered attainable

description.narrative: 6 Number of park management staff appointed equipped trained and deployed in the park

comment.narrative: Approaching target Same as last year

description.narrative: 7 Percentage of park visitors obtaining a permit to traverseovernight in the park

comment.narrative: At least 80

Progress made towards the target 40 of Park visitors is reported Registration and entry fees collection pilot system launch in October 2014 has been reformulated and submitted to the local government authority for approval

description.narrative: 8 Proportion of the plains grassland habitats of the park 600km2 overgrazed by livestock goats and cattle

comment.narrative: More than 35 by 201112
Less than 20

Not possible to assess the indicator with accuracy but there are good indications that the baseline may have been optimistic and the target even more so The aerial survey is yet to be conducted Observations from the ground indicate an increase of at least 40 of the grassland habitats of the park overgrazed by livestock

title.narrative: Promoting climate-resilient development and enhanced adaptive capacity to withstand disaster risks in Angolan’s Cuvelai River Basin

description.narrative: This proposal seeks funding from the LDCF to implement a FSP, specifically in the region of Cuvelai River Basin (Cunene). The project will focus on two NAPA priorities: Create an early warning system and Climate monitoring and data management system.

title.narrative: PIMS 5166_Prodoc ANGOLA CUVELAI BASIN LDCF Final_160203

description.narrative: Promoting climate-resilient development and enhanced adaptive capacity to withstand disaster risks in Angolan’s Cuvelai River Basin
first-order administrative division

activity-description.narrative: Cunene Province is vulnerable to increasing frequency of droughts, floods impacting agriculture and livestock, water resources, rural development and food security, soil erosion. The project had technical meetings with local partners in order to start, as well as an OCHA mission to develop SOP´s for

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities - disaster prevention and preparedness

comment.narrative: 1. The Southern region of Cunene Province, in Angola, is vulnerable to increasing frequency and severity of droughts, floods and severe storms 2. Events impact sectors such as agriculture and livestock, water resources, rural development and food security, as well as soil erosion, built infrastructures and livelihoods. 3. Of particular concern are the Cuvelai River Basin communities and sectors such as agriculture, livestock and water resources which are an important component of the economy in the region and form the basis of rural livelihoods in Cuvelai Basin.
1) Project team set up 2) Initiation workshop completed 3) Detailed workplan for first year elaborated with stakeholders and approved by steering committee

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities - disaster prevention and preparedness

comment.narrative: 1. Policies, regulation and institutions are not geared for effective intervention in the charcoal sector 2. Traditional charcoal production relies on a combination of rudimentary technology, involving virtually zero capital investment, and basic operator skills 3. The institutional and human capacities for the production and use of sustainable charcoal are very weak or nonexistent 4. Need to implement the monitoring and evaluation plan for the project.

1. Select pilot-communities to start the implementation of the project 2. Signature of MoU between MINAMB and IDF 3. Contract a local consortium to implement the activities with the communities 4. Hold the 1st Steering Committee meeting

The 2nd Steering Committee meeting held.

title.narrative: Address Urgent Coastal Adapt Needs and Capacit Gaps Angola

description.narrative: This project will promote and demonstrate cost-effective, low-regret options for adaptation including climate-resilient practices such as Ecosystem based adaptation and climate-resilient land management and establishment of a pilot Early Warning System.

This project will promote and demonstrate cost-effective, low-regret options for adaptation including climate-resilient practices such as Ecosystem based adaptation and climate-resilient land management and establishment of a pilot Early Warning System.
first-order administrative division

activity-description.narrative: Coastal communities in Cabinda, Kwanza Sul, Bengo and Namibe Provinces

description.narrative: first-order administrative division

activity-description.narrative: Coastal communities in Cabinda, Kwanza Sul, Bengo and Namibe Provinces

description.narrative: first-order administrative division

activity-description.narrative: Coastal communities in Cabinda, Kwanza Sul, Bengo and Namibe Provinces

description.narrative: first-order administrative division

activity-description.narrative: Coastal communities in Cabinda, Kwanza Sul, Bengo and Namibe Provinces

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities - disaster prevention and preparedness

comment.narrative: 1) At present, a climate change vulnerability assessment of Angola’s coastal zone – including coastal sectors such as fisheries, agriculture, transport, energy, water and tourism – has not been conducted. 2) Climate change is negatively impacting coastal communities in Angola, including those living in Chiloango, Barra do Dande, Longa and Bero. The livelihoods of the rural coastal communities are underpinned by ecosystem services. 3) In Angola, the policies related to management of natural resources and ecosystems – such as the PNFFSAC – do not include consideration of the current and predicted impacts of climate change. Additionally, the strategies and plans related to coastal planning and ecosystem management – such as the Coastal Zone Master Plan – do not include consideration of potential adaptation measures such as EbA.
1) Inception workshop will take place in Luanda, Angola. 2) Annual workplan with UNEP revised and approved. 3) The Ministry of Environment points out the National Coordinator

1) Stakeholders, government and civil society in general know about the project. 2) UNEP. UNDP and MINAMB work together for the workplan implementation. 3) The Ministry of Environment pointed out the National Coordinator.

description.narrative: Health - policy, planning and administration

1) Number of technician streghtened capcities on M&E, data collection tools and stock management. 2) Number of management project decison making meetings held. 3) Number of health facility with SIS installed and operational. 4) Number of Provinces supervised regarding the use of thermometers, pharmacovigilance. 5) National formulary validated. 6) Transition project for the new global fund grant NFM stablished. (Note: The project started in 2015).

comment.narrative: 1) 338 technicians has been trained on M&E, data collection tools and stock management. 2) The national M&E group (GTNM&E) has been reactivated and TORs of the GTNM&E approved. 3) Software SIS installed at Province level. 4) Installation of thermometers in all the Provincials warehouse and health facilities. 5) List of essentials medicines validated and starting the elaboration of the National Formulary.
1) 70 2) 8 3) 5 4) 9 5) National formulary of medicines validated. 6) Transition project for the new global fund grant NFM submitted.
1) 70 2) 8 3) 5 4) 9 5) National formulary of medicines validated at technical level. 6) Transition project for the new global fund grant NFM signed.

The objective of the GEF PPG is to develop the project concept into a full project.

The objective of the GEF PPG is to develop the project concept into a full project. This project aims to catalyze investments in decentralized renewable energy systems to expand energy access for base-of-the-pyramid consumers and to reduce GHG emissions

title.narrative: Combating Illegal Wildlife Trade and Human Wildlife

description.narrative: Preventing the extinction of terrestrial species by combating illegal wildlife trade (IWT) and reducing human-wildlife conflict (HWC) in Angola. - Project Preparation Grant

The objective of the GEF PPG is to develop the project concept into a full project: “Combating Illegal Wildlife Trade and Human Wildlife Conflict in Angola”. As described in the project concept (PIF/child project concept note), this project aims to prevent the extinction of terrestrial species by combating illegal wildlife trade (IWT) and reducing human-wildlife conflict (HWC) in Angola.
